result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert W. Wildman

records.addlTxt: 1:52 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Robert W. Wildman appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court via zoom for Robert W. Wildman.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Bennet reserves rights and enters pleas of Not Guilty, requests to track along with 20CF155. Court enters Not Guilty pleas and orders case to track along with case no 20CF155. Bond remains. State notes 20CF155 previously had a jury trial, still waiting on a next court date to be scheduled. Court notes 22CF185 will track along with 20CF155.

1:06 PM/RM 203. Defendant Robert W. Wildman in court, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Robert W. Wildman.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. State is ready to proceed with P.H. State requests Court take judicial notice of cases 21CF332 & 20CF155. Court reviews both case records. Atty Bennett is okay to proceed. Court takes judicial notice of cases 21CF332 & 20CF155. State calls first witness, Lt. Detective Don Seubert. Lt. Detective Seubert sworn in under oath and gives testimony. Atty Bennett questions Lt. Detective Don Seubert. State rests. Atty Bennett has nothing further. Court questions jurisdiction on case, State responds. State gives argument and requests Court to bind over. Atty Bennett reserves rights and gives argument. Court has reviewed the criminal complaint, finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings. State requests arraignment at later date. Court schedules arraignment and notes date and time can change if parties agree. State is in compliance with victim rights. Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

No contact with alleged victim or alleged victims residence.
Comply with bond in 20-CF-155 & 21-CF-332

1:06 PM Defendant Robert W. Wildman appeared by video, in custody from Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Robert W. Wildman, via zoom.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court calls alleged victim one more time. Victim appears via telephone. Atty Bennett has just been appointed. Atty Bennett has not spoken to defendant.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Atty Bennett would request p.h. State gives bail/bond recommendations and request cash with condition no contact with victim or 500 yards and comply with prior conditions. Victim makes statement.  Atty Bennett heard on bail/ bond recommendations and gives argument.  Court reviews older case. Atty Bennett reserve all jurisdiction rights. Court gives allegations from probable cause from complaint & gives 3 factors and orders $15,000 cash bond no contact with alleged victim or alleged victims residence and Comply with bond in 20-CF-155 & 21-CF-332.  State heard on zoom for Officer.  Atty Bennett replies. Court orders witness must be in person or State may file proof.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
